text.p: Motorola Transmission Products Division said Tuesday it will immediately resume shipping its SURFR Series of 56-kilobit-per-second computer modems.
Motorola said it and Rockwell International Corp improved the Rockwell chips in the high-speed modems, which are used, for example, to connect computers to the Internet and online services.

In March, Motorola said it delayed further shipments of the modems because of problems with performance in a small number of network configurations. The problem likely affected fewer than 3,000 customers, the company said.
Motorola said at the time it would replace shipped modems at no cost for customers who experienced performance problems.
